abstract_summ: METHODS: We use modelled global air travel data and population density estimates from locations worldwide to analyse the risk that 1364 airports are sources of future COVID-19 outbreaks.We correlate our mobility model to passenger air travel statistics and calibrate our epidemiology model using the number of reported COVID-19 cases for each country.We correlate our mobility model to passenger air travel statistics and calibrate our epidemiology model using the number of reported COVID-19 cases for each country.Methods: We use modelled global air travel data and population density estimates to analyse the risk posed by 1364 airports to initiate a COVID-19 outbreak.There has been notable growth in travel from Warning and Stable countries, which comprise more than three-quarters of international air travel passengers.
title_summ: Outbreak dynamics of COVID-19 in Europe and the effect of travel restrictionsPathways of the COVID-19 Pandemic with Human Mobility across CountriesGlobal trends in air travel: implications for connectivity and resilience to infectious disease threatsEstimating COVID-19 outbreak risk through air travelEvaluating the impact of international airline suspensions on the early global spread of COVID-19Estimating COVID-19 outbreak risk through air travelThe Predictive Capacity of Air Travel Patterns during the Global Spread of the COVID-19 Pandemic: Risk, Uncertainty and RandomnessIdentification of critical airports for controlling global infectious disease outbreaks: Stress-tests focusing in EuropeOutbreak dynamics of COVID-19 in Europe and the effect of travel restrictions.Population flow drives spatio-temporal distribution of COVID-19 in China.
title_abstract_phrases: Estimating COVID-19 outbreak risk through air travelBACKGROUND: Substantial limitations have been imposed on passenger air travel to reduce transmission of SARS-CoV-2 between regions and countries.METHODS: We use modelled global air travel data and population density estimates from locations worldwide to analyse the risk that 1364 airports are sources of future COVID-19 outbreaks.We correlate our mobility model to passenger air travel statistics and calibrate our epidemiology model using the number of reported COVID-19 cases for each country.We correlate our mobility model to passenger air travel statistics and calibrate our epidemiology model using the number of reported COVID-19 cases for each country.Methods: We use modelled global air travel data and population density estimates to analyse the risk posed by 1364 airports to initiate a COVID-19 outbreak.
